name: Exchange Life
description: A guided journey into the exchanged life with Christ – discovering who you are in Jesus, how He lives in you, and how to walk in daily freedom.

modules.title: Module 1 – Introduction to the Exchanged Life
modules.summary: An overview of the Exchanged Life: what it is, why it matters, and how Christ becomes our life.
goals: Understand the basic idea of the exchanged life.
Begin to see your story in light of Christ living in you.
journalPrompts: In your own words, what does it mean that "Christ lives in me"?
Where do you still feel like you are living the Christian life in your own strength?

admit.title: Admit the struggle
admit.description: Lord, I admit that I have been trying to live the Christian life in my own strength, and it is exhausting…

renounce.title: Renounce self-effort
renounce.description: Lord, I renounce the lie that it all depends on me. I renounce the habit of trusting my own effort instead of Your life in me…

confess.title: Confess the truth
confess.description: Lord Jesus, I confess that You live in me, and that my true life is hidden with Christ in God. I confess that You are my life.

modules.title: Module 2 – The New You in Christ
modules.summary: Explore what actually changed when you trusted Christ – your identity, your heart, and your standing before God.
goals: Understand the difference between your old self and your new self in Christ.
Recognize that you are fully accepted, secure, and significant in Jesus.
Begin to reject old labels and embrace your true identity.
journalPrompts: What old labels or identities still cling to you (e.g., failure, not enough, too much)?
Write a short prayer where you thank Jesus for specific truths about who you now are in Him.
Which verse from this module speaks most deeply to you? Why?

admit.title: Admit false identities
admit.description: Lord, I admit that I have believed lies about who I am – based on my past, my failures, and others’ opinions…

renounce.title: Renounce old labels
renounce.description: In Jesus’ name, I renounce the labels and identities that do not come from You – every name and story that contradicts Your Word…

confess.title: Confess who you are in Christ
confess.description: Lord Jesus, I confess that I am a new creation in You – forgiven, loved, accepted, and made righteous by Your finished work.

modules.title: Module 3 – Flesh vs. Spirit
modules.summary: See the ongoing conflict between the flesh and the Spirit, and how to practically walk by the Spirit instead of striving in the flesh.
goals: Define what the Bible means by "flesh" and "Spirit."
Identify flesh patterns in your own life.
Learn how to depend on the Spirit moment by moment.
keyConcepts: The Spirit as the life of Christ in you
journalPrompts: Where do you most often feel yourself “trying harder” instead of trusting the Spirit?
Describe a recent situation where you saw the fruit of the Spirit show up in you. What happened?
Finish this sentence: "Lord, I want to learn to walk by the Spirit especially in…"

admit.title: Admit flesh patterns
admit.description: Lord, I admit that I fall back into flesh patterns – trying to control, fix, please, or protect myself without You…

renounce.title: Renounce self-reliance
renounce.description: In Jesus’ name, I renounce my reliance on my own wisdom, strength, and strategies. I renounce the lie that the flesh can produce life.

confess.title: Confess dependence on the Spirit
confess.description: Holy Spirit, I confess that I need You. I choose to depend on You as my wisdom, power, and life in this situation.

modules.title: Module 4 – Lies, Wounds, and Strongholds
modules.summary: Invite Jesus into the deeper places of hurt, lies, and strongholds that have shaped how you see God, yourself, and others.
goals: Identify key wounds and lies that have shaped your story.
Recognize how the enemy uses lies to build strongholds.
Begin to invite Jesus into specific memories and beliefs.
journalPrompts: Ask the Lord: "Jesus, where did I first start believing this lie about myself or about You?" Write what comes to mind.
Write down one wound or memory that still carries pain. Invite Jesus into that memory in prayer.
What truth from Scripture do you sense the Lord speaking over that wound?

admit.title: Admit the hurt and lies
admit.description: Lord, I admit that I have been deeply hurt here, and I have believed lies about You, myself, and others because of it…

renounce.title: Renounce agreements with lies
renounce.description: In Jesus’ name, I renounce every agreement I have made with the enemy’s lies – especially the lie that… (name it).

confess.title: Confess the truth over the wound
confess.description: Lord Jesus, I confess that Your truth is greater than this pain. I confess that You are near to the brokenhearted and that Your cross is enough for this wound.

modules.title: Module 5 – Walking in Freedom Daily
modules.summary: Learn how to live out the exchanged life in everyday moments – abiding in Christ, responding to temptation, and walking in ongoing surrender and trust.
goals: Connect the exchanged life to daily decisions and habits.
Learn simple ways to practice abiding in Christ.
Form a picture of what long-term freedom can look like.
journalPrompts: What does it practically look like for you to "abide" in Christ on a normal day?
Where are you most afraid to fully trust Jesus right now?
Write a prayer of surrender for the next 30 days, entrusting specific areas of your life to Him.

admit.title: Admit areas of ongoing struggle
admit.description: Lord, I admit that I still struggle to walk in freedom consistently in these areas…

renounce.title: Renounce hopelessness and passivity
renounce.description: In Jesus’ name, I renounce the lie that I will never change, and the lie that I am stuck. I renounce passivity and despair.

confess.title: Confess hope and trust in Christ
confess.description: Lord Jesus, I confess that You are my life, my hope, and my freedom. I confess that You are able to complete the good work You began in me.
